messages.message:
For some fields provenance is not working well yet. I understand why this happens when it's not clear where exactly an extracted value originated from but a lot of times it is very clear and even a regex would find the source location of the value. On the screenshot you can see one example where the extracted value is written exactly the same in the document as it was extracted - but it is not provenance tracked. This happens for all types for documents single page or document package.

Is this something being worked on our is it worth an additional PFR ticket?
@Jasper can you share the details of the field configuration? ie field type, model, any clean functions, etc

For the document on the screenshot it's all text fields with default model. No clean functions. 1 out of the 4 fields has a description, the other 3 fields do not.
Provenance does not work for any of the 4 fields.
Another example is on this payslip, where the correct value is just to the right of the value with the bounding box.
can you provide the sample documents?

cc @Sunny Khatri who has previously looked into improving extraction provenance

are you still working on improving provenance? or do we need a new ticket for this issue?
We're still working on extraction but primarily for form and checkbox related documents. It would be good to create a ticket with the doc.

I would have expected provenance to be working fine here as these are trivial. Is this with FR enabled ? We did had some fixes pushed last week (by the reader team, not sure it has made it to prod yet) for some of the provenance issues related to FR.
@Jasper - Could you file an EPD ticket with the sample doc. Thanks !
